name: Compliance API
description:
# Overview
Compliance API allows to create people KYC profiles and to add and edit his information using issues in a seed/fruit approach

# Authentication
Request to Compliance API uses token based authentication, so an API token is mandatory to interact with the application, consumers can send the auth token in the request headers in this way:

```
curl -X GET \
  https://<compliance_host>/api/people/3138 \
  -H 'Authorization: Token token=<a_valid_token>' \

```

If the token is not present or isn't valid, API responds with a 403 response code in JSON API format

```
{
    "errors": [
        {
            "links": {},
            "status": 403,
            "code": "forbidden",
            "title": "forbidden",
            "detail": "forbidden",
            "source": {},
            "meta": {}
        }
    ]
}
```

requests.name: http://23.21.231.213/api/people/{person_id}/issues/{issue_id}
requests.description: Get a specific issue that belongs to a person

responses.name: Query for an issue that belongs to a person that does not exist

responseCode.name: Not Found
responseCode.detail: The requested resource could not be found but may be available again in the future. Subsequent requests by the client are permissible.

headers.name: Cache-Control
headers.description: Tells all caching mechanisms from server to client whether they may cache this object. It is measured in seconds

headers.name: Connection
headers.description: Options that are desired for the connection

headers.name: Content-Type
headers.description: The mime type of this content

headers.name: Date
headers.description: The date and time that the message was sent

headers.name: Server
headers.description: A name for the server

headers.name: Transfer-Encoding
headers.description: The form of encoding used to safely transfer the entity to the user. Currently defined methods are: chunked, compress, deflate, gzip, identity.

headers.name: X-Content-Type-Options
headers.description: The only defined value, "nosniff", prevents Internet Explorer from MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

headers.name: X-Frame-Options
headers.description: Clickjacking protection: "deny" - no rendering within a frame, "sameorigin" - no rendering if origin mismatch

headers.name: X-Request-Id
headers.description: Custom header

headers.name: X-Runtime
headers.description: Custom header

headers.name: X-XSS-Protection
headers.description: Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter
